column10:
31/05 FIPAG providing piped water through 4 tapstands, 3 more being finalised
FIPAG w/UNICEF system-extension with 7 water points (x2 taps)
column12:
12/05 service currently provided
ACF has constructed 60 latrines (x50=should cover 3,000people=600HHs)
Oxfam distributed 253HKs
column14: Oxfam linking with ACF's emergency work
column16:
In Mandruzi II, DPS is present with a mobile clinic providing basic services except Prenatal consultations, this service would be available with a provision of a tent (UNICEF) in the following days.
UNFPA and AMUDEFA (activists) are present.
there is Mandruzi I (old resettlement, 1 km away of Mandruzi II) where there is the need of a bridge to link with this clinic
column18: Build a health facility in Mandruzi I (old resettlement); this is already conceived in DPS plans for extension of health services provision; needs budget.
column20: TLCs in place for children Gr. 1-3; Children Gr. 4-7 attend classes in existing EPC school 3 km from the camp;  Supplies are available for distribution. The are no teachers available. Unicef/COSACA is supporting the learning activities on site and in the catchment schools
column30: Mobile Unit (UNICEF-ICS partnership) organizes movie engagement sessions focusing on cholera, hygiene annd malaria key message in the ressetlement area, every 2 or 3 weeks. PIRCOM youth volunteers do door to doors mobilisation on cholera, malaria, nutrition and HIV and sexual abuse prevention. CUAMM mobilisers focusing on WASH related messaging are present in the area, depending on the weekly needs. Other humanitarian organisations' prensence TBC.
